meanings.definition: Supernatural powers or abilities attained through spiritual practice.
meanings.sent1: The ancient sage demonstrated his siddhis by levitating effortlessly.
meanings.sent2: Yoga masters are said to possess siddhis like telekinesis and clairvoyance.
meanings.sent3: The magician jokingly claimed his siddhis allowed him to make cookies disappear instantly.
meanings.sent4: Her siddhis seemed to give her an otherworldly aura, as if she could see beyond the physical realm.
meanings.sent5: Legends speak of mystical beings with siddhis so powerful they could control the elements themselves.

meanings.definition: Accomplishments or achievements gained through intense focus and discipline.
meanings.sent1: The young athlete's siddhis in gymnastics earned her a spot in the national team.
meanings.sent2: His academic siddhis were evident when he aced the difficult exam without much effort.
meanings.sent3: The chef's culinary siddhis were on full display as he flawlessly prepared a five-course meal.
meanings.sent4: Her siddhis in negotiation allowed her to secure the deal in record time.
meanings.sent5: The artist's siddhis in painting were so remarkable that each brushstroke seemed to come alive on the canvas.
